choices.F: The Oracle Clusterware stack is started on all nodes.
choices.B: The Oracle Clusterware stack is prevented from being automatically started on HOST01.
choices.A: The Oracle Clusterware stack is stopped on all nodes.
choices.E: The Oracle Clusterware stack is started on all nodes except HOST01.
choices.D: The Oracle Clusterware stack is stopped on all nodes except HOST01.
choices.C: The Oracle Clusterware stack is prevented from being automatically started on all nodes.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABF
ABF is correct

Selected Answer: ABF
https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/21/cwadd/oracle-clusterware-control-crsctl-utility-reference.html#GUID-E66A5FB5-CB4E-452C-8293-1D4C7AD9261F
crsctl disable crs - This command only affects the local server

Selected Answer: ABF
ABF is correct

B explanation: 

crsctl disable crs
Usage Notes
This command only affects the local server
If you disable Oracle High Availability Services automatic startup, you must use the crsctl start crs command to start Oracle High Availability Services

A and F explanation:

crsctl stop cluster
Use the crsctl stop cluster command on any node in the cluster to stop the Oracle Clusterware stack on all servers in the cluster or specific servers.

Syntax
crsctl stop cluster [-all | -n server_name [...]] [-f]
Usage Notes
If you do not specify -all or one or more space-delimited server names, then Oracle Clusterware stops the Oracle Clusterware stack on the local server.

Reference: Documentation: https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E14796_01/doc/rac.112/e10717/crsref.htm

Please only make a submission if you know the correct answer.

Selected Answer: ACF
Looks to be ACF

questions.question_text:
Examine this sequence of commands:
//IMG//

The cluster consists of nodes HOST01, HOST02, HOST03 and HOST04, and the clusterware is running on all four nodes.
Which three statements are true about the result of the root user running these commands on HOST01? (Choose three.)

choices.B: The diagcollection.pl script must be run from the Grid home directory as the grid infrastructure owner.
choices.E: There is one osysmond service for the cluster health monitor (CHM) on each cluster node regardless of cluster size.
choices.D: The oclumon utility may be used to get and set parameters for the cluster health monitor (CHM ) repository.
choices.A: The clusterware log files are stored inside the Grid Infrastructure Management Repository database used by the cluster health monitor (CHM).
choices.C: There is one ologgerd service for the cluster health monitor (CHM) on each cluster node regardless of cluster size.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
I don't know if D is right but E is the only true answer here

Selected Answer: DE
C is wrong - In a cluster, there is one cluster logger service (ologgerd) per 32 nodes.

B is wrong, there is no diagcollection.pl in 19c GRID_HOME,
The answer is D,E

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true concerning diagnostic components and requirements of Oracle 19c Clusterware? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Oracle RAC Resource Management requires the same SGA value for all the instances of a RAC database which is configured during database startup only.
choices.A: Oracle RAC Resource Management only allows assignment of the SGA during instance startup.
choices.D: Oracle RAC Resource Management only allows assignment of the SGA during database startup.
choices.C: Oracle RAC Resource Runtime Management allows for automatic and runtime adjustment of the SGA.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true about Oracle Database 19c SGA Management?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It's C. and no need to have same settings on all nodes: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/racad/administering-database-instances-and-cluster-databases.html#GUID-845E2ECD-9089-4666-BFCD-C42C5F11C6C3

choices.A: Zero Downtime Patching requires out-of-place patching of Oracle Grid Infrastructure 19c with Oracle RAC or Oracle RAC One Node databases of 19c or later releases and only the binaries in the Oracle Grid Infrastructure user space are patched.
choices.C: When using Zero Downtime Patching, Oracle Grid Infrastructure OS system software, kernel modules and system commands including ACFS, AFD, OLFS, and OKA are not updated.
choices.B: When using Zero Downtime Patching, the root.sh script must be executed manually with -nodriverupdate option.
choices.E: Zero Downtime Patching can be fully automated by selecting the option to automatically run the root.sh script.
choices.D: Zero Downtime Patching requires in-place patching of Oracle Grid Infrastructure 19c with Oracle RAC or Oracle RAC One Node databases of 19c or later releases and only the binaries in the Oracle Grid Infrastructure user space are patched.

questions.question_text:
Zero Downtime Patching uses Fleet Patching and Provisioning to patch Oracle Grid Infrastructure without bringing down Oracle RAC database instances.
Which three statements are true about Zero-Downtime Oracle Grid Infrastructure Patching? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Some Grid Infrastructure patchsets may not be intalled in a rolling fashion.
choices.B: When performing rolling patches, the VIPs for the node being patched are relocated to another node.
choices.D: When performing rolling patches, crsctl query crs softwareversion always displays the earliest version of the software running anywhere in the cluster.

questions.question_text: Which statement is true concerning the installation of an Oracle Grid Infrastructure 19c patchset and its status during the installation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C: Some Grid Infrastructure patchsets may not be installed in a rolling fashion." This statement is true
Rolling patches cannot be done when the Oracle software files are stored in a shared cluster file system, which requires a complete outage to patch or upgrade
B: "When performing rolling patches, the VIPs for the node being patched are relocated to another node." This statement is false.
The sources do not describe any relocation of VIPs (Virtual IP Addresses) during patching, although services are migrated between nodes.
While database instances and services might be migrated off the node being patched, the VIP associated with the node is not moved. This is also not mentioned in the context of zero downtime patching

Selected Answer: B
A. They can be applied in-place.

This statement is not always true as some patches require downtime.
B. When performing rolling patches, the VIPs for the node being patched are relocated to another node.

This statement is true. During rolling patches, the Virtual IP addresses (VIPs) are relocated to other nodes to ensure high availability and minimize disruption.
C. Some Grid Infrastructure patchsets may not be installed in a rolling fashion.

While some critical patches might not support rolling upgrades, this is less common with regular patchsets.
D. When performing rolling patches, crsctl query crs softwareversion always displays the earliest version of the software running anywhere in the cluster.

This is incorrect. crsctl query crs softwareversion shows the version of the software on the node where the command is run. To see the cluster-wide version, you would use crsctl query crs activeversion.

Selected Answer: B
Rolling fashon: Nodes are restarted sequentially, so that only one node at a time will be offline, while all other nodes in the cluster remain online.

VIP must be move to another node while patching the node

Selected Answer: B
it is B
